title: Chinese Gov Hackers Caught Hiding in Cisco Router Firmware
description:
The NSA and FBI warn that a Chinese state-sponsored APT called BlackTech is hacking into network edge devices and using firmware implants to silently hop around the corporate networks of U.S. and Japanese companies.

The post Chinese Gov Hackers Caught Hiding in Cisco Router Firmware appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: CISA Unveils New HBOM Framework to Track Hardware Components
description:
CISA unveils a new Hardware Bill of Materials (HBOM) framework for buyers and sellers to communicate about components in physical products.

The post CISA Unveils New HBOM Framework to Track Hardware Components appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Gem Security Lands $23 Million Series A Funding
description:
Israeli security startup Gem Security has raised a total of $34 million to tackle cloud threat detection and incident response.

The post Gem Security Lands $23 Million Series A Funding appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Misconfigured TeslaMate Instances Put Tesla Car Owners at Risk
description:
Attackers can find tons of information on Tesla cars and their drivers by searching for misconfigured TeslaMate instances online.

The post Misconfigured TeslaMate Instances Put Tesla Car Owners at Risk appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Firefox 118 Patches High-Severity Vulnerabilities
description:
Firefox 118 patches six high-severity vulnerabilities, including a memory leak potentially leading to sandbox escape.

The post Firefox 118 Patches High-Severity Vulnerabilities appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Stolen GitHub Credentials Used to Push Fake Dependabot Commits
description:
Threat actors have been using stolen GitHub personal access tokens to push malicious code posing as Dependabot contributions.

The post Stolen GitHub Credentials Used to Push Fake Dependabot Commits appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Google Open Sources Binary File Comparison Tool BinDiff
description:
Google has released the source code of BinDiff, a binary file comparison tool popular within the security research community, on GitHub.

The post Google Open Sources Binary File Comparison Tool BinDiff appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: macOS 14 Sonoma Patches 60 Vulnerabilities
description:
macOS 14 Sonoma has been officially released by Apple and the latest version of the operating system patches over 60 vulnerabilities.

The post macOS 14 Sonoma Patches 60 Vulnerabilities appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: New GPU Side-Channel Attack Allows Malicious Websites to Steal Data
description:
GPUs from AMD, Apple, Arm, Intel, Nvidia and Qualcomm are vulnerable to a new type of side-channel attack named GPU.zip.

The post New GPU Side-Channel Attack Allows Malicious Websites to Steal Data appeared first on SecurityWeek.
